intro: Centropogon eilersii, commonly known as the Eilers' grassvane, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Centropogon eilersii is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
